item.title: 能源辩论升温，台湾关闭最后一座核反应堆
item.description: 随着为期 40 年的运行许可证到期，台湾于周六开始关闭其最后一座核反应堆，此举可能威胁到台湾的能源安全和气候目标。【原文：Taiwan started to shut its final nuclear reactor on Saturday as a 40-year operating license expired, in a move that could threaten the island’s energy security and climate goals.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火后，爱迪生公司计划投资 62 亿美元实施防火计划
item.description: 在毁灭性野火席卷洛杉矶四个月后，爱迪生国际南加州公用事业公司提交了一份价值 62 亿美元的减灾计划，其中包括安装数百英里的地下配电线路等措施。【原文：Four months after devastating wildfires swept across Los Angeles, Edison International’s Southern California utility submitted a $6.2 billion mitigation plan that includes installing hundreds of miles of underground distribution lines, among other measures.】

item.title: 巴克莱银行的 Graper 称，随着同行的退缩，银行加倍重视环境、社会和公司治理
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）债务资本市场全球主管表示，由于与其竞争的许多贷款机构都在朝着相反的方向发展，这家英国银行已经努力更加关注环境、社会和公司治理问题。【原文：Barclays Plc’s global head of debt capital markets said the British bank has made an effort to focus more on environmental, social and corporate governance issues as many lenders it competes with have moved in the opposite direction.】

item.title: 巴塞尔委员会抵制美国要求淡化气候风险的压力
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，本周，美国为遏制巴塞尔委员会对气候风险的关注而做出的努力遭到了罕见的抵制。【原文：US efforts to rein in the Basel Committee’s focus on climate risks were met with a rare show of resistance this week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国太阳能企业在关税休战下加快全球扩张步伐
item.description: 中国太阳能企业高管在一次在线投资者吹风会上表示，中美之间为期 90 天的关税休战将带来更加稳定的贸易环境，中国太阳能企业将继续拓展新兴海外市场。【原文：Chinese solar companies will continue their expansion into emerging overseas markets during a 90-day tariff truce between the US and China that brings a more stable trade environment, company executives said at an online investor briefing.】

item.title: 魁北克投资者将收购破产的巴士制造商雄狮电动车公司
item.description: 蒙特利尔房地产大亨文森特-奇亚拉（Vincent Chiara）参与的一个投资集团将控制破产的雄狮电动汽车公司（Lion Electric Co.【原文：An investor group involving Montreal real estate tycoon Vincent Chiara is set to take control of bankrupt Lion Electric Co., offering new capital to keep the electric bus and truck maker alive.】

item.title: 温和派共和党人游说众议院议长修正能源信用额度
item.description: 众议院温和派共和党人正在游说众议院议长迈克-约翰逊（Mike Johnson）在共和党计划于下周提交的广泛税收和支出法案中减少对几项清洁能源税收抵免的削减。【原文：Moderate House Republicans are lobbying House Speaker Mike Johnson to lessen cuts to several clean energy tax credits in the broad tax and spending bill prior to the GOP’s plans to bring it to the floor next week.】

item.title: 欧盟将为渴水的数据中心设定用水上限
item.description: 欧盟将致力于制定最低性能标准，以控制数据中心的用水量，因为未来几十年欧洲大陆可能会面临水资源短缺的问题。【原文：The European Union will work on setting minimum performance standards to curb water usage in data centers as the continent confronts potential shortages over the coming decades.】

item.title: 氢气初创企业 ZeroAvia 目标融资 1.5 亿美元
item.description: 清洁航空初创企业 ZeroAvia 正努力在新一轮融资中筹集约 1.5 亿美元，以推动其首款氢燃料电池发动机的商业化应用。【原文：Clean-aviation startup ZeroAvia is working to raise about $150 million in a new funding round as it progresses toward commercial introduction of its first hydrogen fuel-cell engine.】

item.title: 安桥公司将向加拿大原住民组织出售不列颠哥伦比亚省天然气管道股份
item.description: Enbridge 公司计划将不列颠哥伦比亚省天然气管道系统的股份出售给土著社区，这笔交易将得到加拿大政府的财政支持。【原文：Enbridge Inc. plans to sell a stake in a natural gas pipeline system in British Columbia to Indigenous communities in a deal that will be financially backed by the Canadian government.】

item.title: 微软与 Montag's Rubicon 签订重大碳清除协议
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）已同意出资从大气中提取 1,800 万吨二氧化碳，这将是有史以来规模最大的碳减排信用额购买活动之一。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has agreed to finance the extraction of 18 million tons of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere, in what’s set to be one of the largest-ever purchases of carbon removal credits.】

item.title: 万亿美元基金经理谈 2025 年气候投资
item.description:
惠灵顿管理公司（Wellington Management）的格雷格-沃瑟曼（Greg Wasserman）对企业进行气候投资已有近 20 年的历史，那么他是如何权衡当前形势的呢？【原文：

Greg Wasserman of Wellington Management has been making climate investments in companies for almost 20 years, so how does he weigh up the current moment?

】

item.title: 共和党税收计划瞄准与中国有关的清洁能源供应
item.description: 共和党试图削减清洁能源补贴的税收计划中包含了一些条款，有可能比提议的时间更早结束激励措施。【原文：A Republican tax plan seeking to cut clean-energy subsidies includes provisions that threaten to end the incentives even earlier than proposed.】

item.title: 监管机构称约 8,900 万美国人面临夏季电力短缺风险
item.description: 从上中西部到墨西哥湾沿岸的数百万美国人正面临着美国今夏最大的电力供应短缺威胁。【原文：Millions of Americans from the upper Midwest to the Gulf Coast are facing the biggest threat of power supply shortfalls in the US this summer.】

item.title: 对冲基金 Fermat 预测巨灾债券市场将激增 20
item.description: 对冲基金费马资本管理公司（Fermat Capital Management）预计，今年巨灾债券市场将增长 20%，因为在极端天气、人口密度和通货膨胀日益影响世界的情况下，以灾害为基础的产品将大行其道。【原文：Hedge fund Fermat Capital Management expects the market for catastrophe bonds to grow 20% this year, as a product based on disasters gains ground in a world increasingly shaped by extreme weather, population density and inflation.】

item.title: 美国数据中心将增加不含海外开采锂的电池
item.description:
第一块电池将于 2027 年安装，作为提供可靠电力的一部分。【原文：

The first battery will be installed in 2027 as part of a bid to provide reliable power.

】

item.title: 卡尼表示对修改绿色法律以促进能源项目持开放态度
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，他将考虑修改其前任贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）通过的环境法规，以促进包括石油和天然气管道在内的加拿大重大项目的投资。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney said he’ll consider altering environmental regulations passed by his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, in order to facilitate investment in major projects in Canada, including oil and gas pipelines.】

item.title: 参议院共和党人对众议院取消能源减税的计划表示反对
item.description: 参议院的主要共和党人正在抵制众议院削减清洁能源税收抵免的计划，誓言减轻对新兴技术的打击。【原文：Key Senate Republicans are resisting the House’s plan to gut clean energy tax credits, vowing to soften the blow for emerging technologies.】

item.title: 美国共和党削减美国气候开支计划的最大输家
item.description:
该提案将取消广受欢迎的电动汽车和家用太阳能税收抵免。【原文：

The proposal would eliminate popular tax credits for electric vehicles and home solar. 

】

item.title: 中国企业将向埃塞俄比亚矿业和太阳能产业投资 17.5 亿美元
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚财政部长艾哈迈德-希德（Ahmed Shide）表示，埃塞俄比亚预计将有五家中国公司在这个东非国家投资总计 17.5 亿美元，主要用于太阳能电池制造和矿产勘探。【原文：Ethiopia expects five Chinese companies to invest a total of $1.75 billion in the East African nation, mainly in solar-cell manufacturing and mineral exploration, according to Finance Minister Ahmed Shide.】

item.title: 美国众议院提案好于预期，太阳能股价飙升
item.description: 在众议院共和党人公布了一份税收法案草案之后，美国太阳能公司股价大涨，该草案对该行业的许多参与者比分析师预期的要宽松。议员们还提议取消氢气生产税收抵免，导致 Plug Power 公司股价下跌。【原文：Shares in US solar companies jumped after House Republicans released a draft of a tax bill that went easier on many players in the sector than analysts had expected. The lawmakers also proposed eliminating a production tax credit for hydrogen, sending Plug Power Inc. stock lower.】

item.title: 随着海岸线的侵蚀，加州一城市考虑 "立即撤退
item.description:
卡尔斯巴德与许多其他海滨社区不同，它可能拥有足够的时间、空间和资源来应对海岸侵蚀。【原文：

Carlsbad, unlike many other seaside communities, might just have the time, space and resources to get ahead of coastal erosion. 

】

item.title: 受关税影响最严重的汽车可能不是你想象的那种
item.description:
汽车制造商更有可能对最受欢迎的轿车和卡车提价，而不一定是对最受欢迎的外国车型提价。

汽车制造商更有可能对最受欢迎的轿车和卡车提价，而不一定是对最受欢迎的外国车型提价。【原文：

Carmakers are more likely to hike prices for the most coveted cars and trucks, not necessarily the most foreign.

】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司称今夏可能限水
item.description: 泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Utilities Ltd. —）告诉立法者，不排除今年夏天需要要求用户限制用水量。【原文：Thames Water Utilities Ltd. — which serves about a quarter of the UK including London — told lawmakers it can’t rule out needing to ask customers to restrict water usage this summer.】

item.title: 台湾为重启原子能发电厂打开逆转之门
item.description: 台湾立法者周二修订了一项核电法案，实际上为重启岛上的原子工厂打开了大门，此举凸显了随着台湾能源需求的增长和地缘政治紧张局势的恶化，其政策正在发生更广泛的转变。【原文：Taiwanese lawmakers revised a nuclear power bill on Tuesday that effectively opens the door for a restart of the island’s atomic plants, a move that underscores a wider policy shift as its energy demand grows and geopolitical tensions worsen.】

item.title: 中国太阳能股票因减产计划报道而大涨
item.description: 当地媒体报道称，一家大型企业正在与同行商谈全行业减产事宜，以支撑因供应过剩而跌至谷底的价格，此后中国太阳能股票周二跳涨。【原文：Chinese solar stocks jumped on Tuesday after local media reported a major firm was in talks with peers about an industry-wide output cut in a bid to support prices that have hit rock bottom due to oversupply.】

item.title: 剑桥大学研究称，投资者面临 ESG 冲击，因为风险被错误定价
item.description: 剑桥大学学者的一项研究表明，投资者缺乏追逐可持续目标的经济动力，一旦情绪发生变化，他们将更容易遭受损失。【原文：Investors lack financial incentives to chase sustainable targets, leaving them more exposed to losses once sentiment shifts, according to a study by academics at the University of Cambridge.】

item.title: 美国共和党将逐步取消拜登清洁能源信贷，为减税买单
item.description: 众议院共和党人提议取消对电动汽车的税收减免，并逐步取消对清洁能源生产的激励措施，以帮助支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的大规模税收方案。【原文：House Republicans are proposing to eliminate a tax credit for electric vehicles and phase out incentives for the production of clean energy to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax package.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省冻结工业碳税以帮助企业应对关税对经济的冲击
item.description: 阿尔伯塔省正在冻结其工业碳税，以帮助在美国关税影响下苦苦挣扎的企业，这可能会给首相马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）的政府带来挑战。【原文：Alberta is freezing its industrial carbon tax in a bid to help companies struggling with the effects of US tariffs, potentially setting up a challenge to the government of Prime Minister Mark Carney.】

item.title: 特朗普削减开支迫使清洁技术公司考虑退出美国市场
item.description: 前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）领导下有资格获得支持的清洁技术公司现在正考虑离开美国，因为负责审查这些公司的项目的前负责人说，特朗普政府已经停止了对这些公司的融资。【原文：Clean-tech companies that were eligible for support under former President Joe Biden are now considering leaving the US as the Trump administration pulls the plug on financing, according to the former head of the program that vetted the firms.】
